alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 12:59AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Delaware and northern Randolph Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 1259 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Albany, or near Dunkirk, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Delaware and northern Randolph Counties, including the following locations... Eaton, Parker City, Albany, Ridgeville, Selma and Gaston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
